title: Run release-blocking gate after objective-contract snapshot integration
description: Execute the release gate after objective-contract snapshot and release-readiness artifact changes, publish PASS/FAIL evidence, and disposition the stale blocked release-gate artifact with explicit rationale.
acceptance_criteria: Release-gate evidence records PASS/FAIL for mandatory stages and includes release-readiness checklist + known-issues artifact links
Blocked item `RK-AUTO-BACKLOG-0010-F06` is explicitly dispositioned as completed or superseded with a concrete rationale
Any failing mandatory stage produces owner_role-tagged blocker notes with exact failing command/output path

title: Generate next backlog tranche
description: Queue is running low. Review completed/blocked work and generate the next set of concrete implementation tasks across backend, frontend, design, content, QA, and platform/release with dependencies and acceptance criteria. Keep the backlog inside the first vertical slice scope and defer out-of-scope ideas. Prioritize fast cycle throughput: bias toward implementation tasks (backend/frontend/design/content/platform) and add dedicated QA/regression tasks only when risk is critical or release-blocking.
acceptance_criteria: At least 3 new queued tasks are created or requeued
Each task has owner_role, dependencies, and acceptance criteria
Tasks reflect current project priorities and unblock progress
Generated tranche is implementation-heavy; non-critical QA/lead coordination tasks are minimized
Tasks stay within first vertical slice scope; out-of-scope ideas are deferred
